results.title: The Nose has it
results.brief_description: Arthur Askey, as an official of the Ministry of Health, gives a humorous lecture on infections and states of the nose. Anti-sneezing propaganda.

results.title: The Nose = Le Nez
results.creator_credit: Cinema Nouveau, Alexandre Alexeieff and Claire Parker
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Nicoli Gogol and drawn on pinboard, tells of a young man who unwittingly loses his nose at the barbers. After an unsuccessful and exhausting search, the nose is returned to him. Next morning he calls again at the barbers for a shave.

results.title: The Northern Territory
results.brief_description: A broad view of developments in the Territory, showing the wide range of mineral resources being exploited, the expansion of the cattle industry and new industries, and the improvement of transport.

results.title: The Northern run
results.creator_credit: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: The story of the Queensland Coast and Torres Strait Pilot Service told by four of the master mariners of the service. Each year the pilots take some 1500 overseas and coastal vessels through these hazardous but beautiful parts. Beneath the beauty of the Great Barrier Reef there are hazards; strong tidal streams, saw-toothed reefs, the skeletons of wrecked ships, and other menaces.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove

results.title: The North wind and the sun: an Aesop fable
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Combining old world and modern elements, this colorful animated film tells the story of a contest between the north wind and the sun. “You can sometimes do more by being gentle than you can by using force” is the useful lesson children will gain from this film.

results.title: The North Sea: where do you draw the line
results.creator_credit: Peter Clark, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Looks at the question of where the line should be drawn in relation to off-shore boundaries, fishing quotas, gravel extraction, pollution limits and storm surges in the North Sea. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The North has changed
results.brief_description: Once remote from the world’s mineral markets, the Canadian North is rapidly changing. This film shows what is happening as government and private interests work to develop the North’s mineral resources and to build the roads, railways and airfields that will bring the wealth to market. One new frontiersman seen in the film is a young geologist whose company in Japan seeks the North’s copper.

results.title: The North east: Port of New York
results.creator_credit: Alan Seeger, National Broadcasting Company, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and George Silano
results.brief_description: The Port of New York is a pivotal trade centre, geographically, in world trade. Economically it is the busiest harbour in the world and illustrates the dependence of nations upon the exchange of goods.

results.title: The North = El Norte
results.creator_credit: Anna Thomas, Independent Productions (AU), American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Channel 4 and Gregory Nava
results.brief_description: A moving look at war-torn Guatemala and the plight of illegal aliens through the eyes of a young brother and sister. They move ‘north’ to America, for a life of freedom and happiness but as illegal immigrants their dreams quickly crumble and it will take everything they’ve got to survive the harsh reality of city life. Cast includes Zaide Silvia Gutierrez, David Villalpando, Ernesto Gomez Cruz, and Alicia del Lago.
